(10) days after receiving the application or a copy thereof. The Health Officer shall make or cause to be made inspections in regard to such licenses with
respect to the care and handling of food, the preventing of nuisances and the spread of disease, for the protection of the public health; the Chief Building
Inspector shall make or cause to be made any such inspections relative to the construction of buildings or other structures. All other investigations, except
where otherwise provided, shall be made by the Chiefs of the Police or Fire Departments, the Director of Public Works or by some other officer designated
by the City Manager. (1993 Code)
3-1-6: FEES:
In the absence of provision to the contrary, all fees and charges for licenses or permits shall be paid in advance at the time application therefor is made to
the City Clerk, and no such fee shall be less than the annual amount provided therefor, unless more than six (6) months of the current fiscal year has
expired in which case one-half (1/2) the annual fee shall be paid. (1993 Code)
3-1-7: VEHICLE TAG:
Whenever the number of vehicles or machines used is the basis for any license fee, the City Clerk shall furnish each licensee with a tag, emblem or sticker
for each vehicle or machine covered by the license, and such tag, emblem or sticker shall be posted in a permanent and conspicuous place on each such
vehicle or machine while it is in use. (1993 Code)
3-1-8: BOND OR INSURANCE PREREQUISITE TO ISSUANCE:
Wherever a bond or insurance is required by any provision of this Code as a prerequisite to the issuance of any license, no license shall be issued until all
requirements relating thereto have been complied with and a satisfactory certificate of indemnity, cash or insurance is filed with the City Clerk. (1993 Code)
3-1-9: TERMINATION OF LICENSES:
All annual licenses shall terminate on the last day of the fiscal year of the City, where no provision to the contrary is made.
The City Clerk shall mail to all licensees of the City a statement of the time of expiration of the license held by the licensee, if annual, three (3) weeks prior
to the date of such expiration; provided, however, that a failure to send out such notice, or the failure of the licensee to receive it, shall not excuse the
licensee from a failure to obtain a new license, or a renewal thereof, nor shall it be defense in an action for operation without a license. (1993 Code)
3-1-10: BUILDINGS AND PREMISES:
No license shall be issued for the conduct of any business, and no permit shall be issued for any thing or act, if the premises and buildings to be used for
the purpose do not fully comply with all provisions of this Code.1 No such license or permit shall be issued for the conduct of any business or performance
of any act which would involve a violation of the zoning regulations of the City.2 (1993 Code)
3-1-11: CHANGE OF LOCATION:
The location of any licensed business or occupation, or of any permitted act, may be changed, provided that ten (10) days' written notice thereof is given to
the City Clerk, in the absence of any provision to the contrary; provided further, that all building, zoning and frontage consent requirements of this Code are
complied with. (1993 Code)
3-1-12: NUISANCES:
No business, whether licensed or unlicensed, shall be so conducted or operated as to constitute a nuisance in fact.3 (1993 Code)
3-1-13: POSTING OF LICENSES REQUIRED:
It shall be the duty of any person conducting or operating any licensed business within the City to keep the license therefor posted in a prominent place,
and at all times, upon the premises used for such business or upon such vehicle or machine in the manner prescribed by the City Clerk. (1993 Code)
3-1-14: WAIVER OF FEES FOR DISABLED VETERANS:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 171/687
The City Council shall have the power to waive the fees for vending licenses required under any provisions of this Code, upon application for such license
by disabled veterans who are residents of the City. (1993 Code)
3-1-15: INSPECTIONS; ANALYSES; PENALTY FOR INTERFERENCE:
A. Whenever inspections of the premises used for or in connection with the operation of a licensed business or occupation are provided for or required by
law, or are reasonably necessary to secure compliance with any provision of this Code, or to detect violations thereof, it shall be the duty of the
licensee, or the person in control of the premises to be inspected, to admit thereto for the purpose of making the inspection any officer or employee of
the City who is authorized to make such inspection, at any reasonable hour that admission is requested.
B. Whenever an analyses of any commodity or material is reasonably necessary to secure conformance with any provision of this Code, or to detect
violations thereof, it shall be the duty of the licensee whose business is governed by such provision to give to any authorized officer or employee of the
City requesting the same sufficient samples of such material or commodity for such analysis upon request.
C. In addition to any other penalty which may be provided, the City Manager may revoke the license of any proprietor of any business in the City who
refuses to permit any such officer or employee who is authorized to make such inspection or take such sample to make such analysis or take an
adequate sample of the said commodity, or who interferes with such officer or employee while in the performance of his duty in making such inspection.
Provided, however, that no license shall be revoked for such cause unless written demand is made upon the licensee or person in control of the
premises, in the name of the City, stating that such inspection or sample is desired at the time it is sought to make the inspection or obtain the sample.
(1993 Code)
3-1-16: REVOCATION; SUSPENSION; NO REFUND OF FEE:
A. Any license or permit may be revoked, or suspended for a limited time, by the City Manager at any time during the duration of such license or permit for
any violation by the licensee or permittee or their agents of any provision of this Code relating to such license or permit, including the failure to secure
the same or the intentional misrepresentation as to any material fact upon the application therefor, or to the premises occupied or used, or of any State
or Federal law relating thereto; and such revocation or suspension may be in addition to any monetary fine imposed.
B. In case of revocation or suspension of any license, no part of any license fee shall be refunded by the City. (1993 Code)
3-1-17: NOTICE OF REVOCATION; REQUEST FOR HEARING; SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION:
A. Unless any provision of this Code provides to the contrary, no revocation or suspension of any license or permit issued hereunder shall be deemed
effective until notice thereof has been served personally upon or mailed to the named licensee or permittee at the address specified in the application
for the said license or permit.
B. If, within five (5) days of the date of notice of the revocation or suspension of any license or permit, the named licensee or permittee submits to the City
Clerk in writing a request for a hearing concerning such revocation or suspension, said revocation or suspension shall be suspended until such time as
the City Council shall grant the licensee or permittee a special hearing.
C. If the Council after such hearing affirms the revocation or suspension of said license or permit, the same shall become immediately effective; if the
Council by a majority vote overrules the revocation or suspension, the same shall be deemed null and void. (1993 Code)
Chapter 2
BEER AND LIQUOR CONTROL
3-2-1: DEFINITIONS:
For the purposes of this chapter, the definitions provided in Iowa Code (2005) section 123.3 are adopted and shall govern the meaning of language in this
chapter unless such term is specially defined elsewhere. In addition, the following definitions are adopted for this chapter:
CHILDCARE CENTER: A facility that provides childcare or preschool services as defined by Iowa Code (2005) section 237A.1(4), which is adopted by
reference.
CHURCH: Any building or site whose primary use is public religious worship.
DRINKING PLACE: A licensed premises primarily engaged in the retail sale of alcoholic drinks, such as beer, ale, wine and liquor, for consumption on the
premises. "Primarily engaged" shall mean gross sales of fifty percent (50%) or greater of total gross sales which shall be the burden of the licensee to
establish.
OUTDOOR SERVICE AREA: An area outside of but immediately adjacent to a building housing a licensed or permitted premises, which area has been
approved for use for the sale, dispensing or consumption of alcoholic beverages or beer pursuant to the provisions of this chapter, chapter 123, code of
Iowa, as amended, and chapter 150 of the Iowa administrative code, as amended. An outdoor service area shall include any outdoor area where beer or
liquor is to be sold, served, carried or consumed by the public and shall be considered as part of the licensed premises. The same federal and state laws
and local ordinances which apply to the licensed premises shall also apply to the outdoor service area.
PRESCHOOL: A facility as defined by Iowa Code (2005) section 237A.1(14) which is adopted by reference.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 172/687
SCHOOL: A public or private elementary, middle, junior or senior high school. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-2: LICENSE OR PERMIT REQUIRED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to sell, offer or keep for sale alcoholic liquor, beer, or wine without first securing a liquor control license, beer permit, or
wine permit in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and state law. Iowa Code (2005) sections 123.2, 123.122, or 123.171 are adopted herein by
reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-3: NATURE OF A LICENSE OR PERMIT AND TRANSFERABILITY:
The provisions of Iowa Code (2005) section 123.38 are hereby adopted by reference. The council may, in its discretion, authorize a licensee or permittee
to transfer the license or permit from one location to another within the city; provided, that the premises to which the transfer is to be made would have
been eligible for a license or permit in the first instance, and such transfer will not result in the violation of any law or ordinance. An applicant for such a
transfer shall file with the application a transfer fee in the amount of fifty dollars ($50.00). (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-4: CLASSES OF LICENSES AND PERMITS, APPLICATION, INVESTIGATION, APPROVAL, FEES, AND REFUNDS:
The following sections of the code of Iowa (2005) are adopted by reference and shall govern the classes of permits and licenses under this chapter, and
the application, investigation, approval, and fees of such applications and fee refunds: sections 123.30, 123.31, 123.32, 123.35, 123.36, 123.123, 123.124,
123.125, 123.127, 123.128, 123.129, 123.130, 123.131, 123.132, 123.134, 123.139, 123.140, 123.172, 123.173, 123.174, 123.175, 123.177, 123.178,
123.178A, 123.178B, 123.179. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-5: INVESTIGATION PROCEDURE:
A. Upon submission of an original application for a liquor license or beer or wine permit to the city clerk, each person listed in the original application, or
who possesses an ownership interest in the establishment, shall also obtain and provide the city clerk with an officially sealed Iowa division of criminal
investigation ("DCI") personal background check at that person's own expense. Each such person who is not a resident of the state of Iowa shall
submit an officially sealed criminal investigation personal background check issued from that person's state of residence. The city clerk may forward a
copy of the original application documents to the police chief. The police chief may then conduct an investigation as to the truth of the facts averred in
the application documents and transmit the results to the city clerk who will make a recommendation to the city council for approval or disapproval of
the application. No approval of the license or permit shall occur until the city clerk has received the results of any such investigation.
B. Upon submission of an application for renewal of a current liquor license or beer or wine permit to the city clerk, any person listed in the renewal
application, or who possesses an ownership interest in the establishment, who did not previously obtain and provide the city clerk with an officially
sealed DCI personal background check must do so at that person's own expense. Each such person who is not a resident of the state of Iowa shall
submit an officially sealed criminal investigation personal background check issued from that person's state of residence. The city clerk may forward a
copy of the renewal application documents to the police chief. The police chief may then review and comment on the renewal application to the city
clerk who will make a recommendation to the city council for approval or disapproval of the renewal application. No approval for renewal of a license or
permit shall occur until the city clerk has received the results of any such investigation. (Ord. 1912, 3-7-2011)
3-2-6: LOCATION OF PREMISES:
A licensed or permitted premises must be located where the applicable zoning ordinance allows such land use. In addition, a licensed or permitted
premises must be in compliance with applicable fire and building codes. No such licensed or permitted premises in which a class A, B, C, or D liquor
control license or a class B beer permit or class C native wine permit shall be located within two hundred feet (200') of a church, school, preschool, or
childcare center building if said premises is a "drinking place" as defined in this chapter. In determining the distance set out in this section, the
measurements shall be taken on a direct line from the nearest point of a building wherein the said licensed premises is located to the nearest part of a
church, school, preschool, or childcare center building. Any licensed or permitted premises that held such license and permit prior to September 26, 2005,
and which does not conform to the provisions of this section, or any licensed or permitted premises that is rendered out of compliance with this section by
the establishment of a church, school, preschool or childcare center within two hundred feet (200') of such preexisting drinking place, shall be permitted to
continue at such location, providing the applicant for such license or permit is qualified and complies with the provisions of chapter 123 of the code of Iowa,
as amended, and there is no discontinuance of such use of the premises for a period of six (6) months. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-7: OUTDOOR SERVICE AREAS:
A. Intent: To provide standards for the approval of requests for outdoor service areas in conjunction with a bar or restaurant in which the serving and
consumption of alcoholic beverages is permitted.
B. Application: A licensee or permittee pursuant to this chapter may apply to the city clerk's office for local permission to serve the type of alcoholic liquor,
beer or wine permitted by the license or permit in an outdoor service area. Such local approval is subject to the approval of the Iowa alcoholic
beverages division. The licensee or permittee must demonstrate through its application and support materials the following:
1. The outdoor area is contiguous with the licensed establishment.
2. The boundary of the outdoor area is delineated by a barrier which clearly identifies the area in which outdoor consumption of alcohol is allowed.
3. The barrier is of a design that discourages the free movement of people between the outdoor service area and nonlicensed or nonpermitted areas.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 173/687
4. If the outdoor service area is to be used for more than a two (2) week period, it shall be constructed of a material that is in character with the
architecture of the contiguous building and shall be in character with the surrounding areas. Snow fence, field fence, or galvanized chainlink shall not
be an accepted material to delineate the space for outdoor service areas used for more than a two (2) week period.
5. Densely planted shrubbery in conjunction with an approved railing or fencing may be permitted if it is determined that the intent is met.
6. The outdoor service area must provide emergency exits sized and spaced in accordance with the fire and building codes. Such exits shall be clearly
identified and provide unobstructed areas to a public way.
C. Construction, Expansion Or Redevelopment: Construction, expansion or redevelopment of an outdoor service area shall be subject to all other
applicable zoning, development, building, and fire safety provisions of this code. Prior to such construction, expansion or redevelopment of an outdoor
service area, the applicant must submit the following materials to the city clerk's office for review by applicable city departments and approval:
1. A diagram which illustrates the outdoor area, in relation to the adjacent licensed establishment and other adjacent buildings.
2. A dimensioned plan of the proposed outdoor area that identifies all exitways.
3. An illustration of the barrier which identifies materials, dimensions and the method of anchoring. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-8: EXPIRATION AND SEASONAL PERMITS:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.34 is adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-9: CIVIL LIABILITY:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.92 is adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-10: PUBLIC CONSUMPTION OF ALCOHOL:
It shall be unlawful for any person to consume or drink any alcoholic beverages on any public street, highway, sidewalk, alley, or public walkway in the city,
except as expressly authorized by the city council or specifically allowed elsewhere in this code. A violation of this section is a simple misdemeanor and
shall be punished as provided in Iowa Code (2009) 903.1.1(a), maximum sentence for misdemeanants, which is adopted by reference. (Ord. 1841, 9-21-
2009)
3-2-11: PERSONS UNDER LEGAL AGE; PENALTY:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.47, subsections (1), (2), and (3) are adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-12: PARENTAL AND SCHOOL NOTIFICATION FOR PERSONS UNDER EIGHTEEN:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.47B is adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-13: MISCELLANEOUS PROHIBITIONS:
A. A person shall not sell, dispense, or give to an intoxicated person, or one simulating intoxication, any alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer.
1. A person other than a person required to hold a license or permit under Iowa Code chapter 123 who dispenses or gives an alcoholic beverage, wine,
or beer in violation of this subsection is not civilly liable to an injured person or the estate of a person for injuries inflicted on that person as a result of
intoxication by the consumer of the alcoholic beverage, wine, or beer.
2. The Iowa general assembly declares that this subsection shall be interpreted so that the holding of Clark v. Mincks, 364 N.W.2d. 226 (Iowa 1985) is
abrogated in favor of prior judicial interpretation finding the consumption of alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer rather than the serving of alcoholic
beverages, wine, or beer as the proximate cause of injury inflicted upon another by an intoxicated person.
B. A person or club holding a liquor control license or retail wine or beer permit under Iowa Code chapter 123, and the person's or club's agents or
employees, shall not do any of the following:
1. Knowingly permit any gambling, except in accordance with Iowa Code chapter 99B, 99D, 99F, or 99G, or knowingly permit solicitation for immoral
purposes, or immoral or disorderly conduct on the premises covered by the license or permit.
2. Sell or dispense any alcoholic beverage or beer on the premises covered by the license or permit, or permit its consumption thereon between the
hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. on a weekday, and between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. on Sunday and six
o'clock (6:00) A.M. on the following Monday, however, a holder of a liquor control license or retail beer permit granted the privilege of selling alcoholic
liquor or beer on Sunday may sell or dispense alcoholic liquor or beer between the hours of eight o'clock (8:00) A.M. on Sunday and two o'clock
(2:00) A.M. on the following Monday.
3. Sell alcoholic beverages, wine, or beer to any person on credit, except with a bona fide credit card. This provision does not apply to sales by a club
to its members, to sales by a hotel or motel to bona fide registered guests, nor to retail sales by the managing entity of a convention center, civic
center, or events center.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 174/687
4. Keep on premises covered by a liquor control license any alcoholic liquor in any container except the original package purchased from the Iowa
alcohol beverages division, and except mixed drinks or cocktails mixed on the premises for immediate consumption. This prohibition does not apply
to common carriers holding a class D liquor control license.
5. Reuse for packaging alcoholic liquor or wine any container or receptacle used originally for packaging alcoholic liquor or wine; or adulterate, by the
addition of any substance, the contents or remaining contents of an original package of an alcoholic liquor or wine; or knowingly possess any original
package which has been so reused or adulterated.
6. Employ a person under eighteen (18) years of age in the sale or serving of alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer for consumption on the premises where
sold.
7. Allow any person other than the licensee, permittee, or employees of the licensee or permittee, to use or keep on the licensed premises any
alcoholic liquor in any bottle or other container which is designed for the transporting of such beverages, except as permitted in Iowa Code section
123.95. This subsection does not apply to the lodging quarters of a class B liquor control licensee or wine or beer permittee, or to common carriers
holding a class D liquor control license.
8. Sell, give, or otherwise supply any alcoholic beverage, wine, or beer to any person, knowing or failing to exercise reasonable care to ascertain
whether the person is under legal age, or permit any person, knowing or failing to exercise reasonable care to ascertain whether the person is under
legal age, to consume any alcoholic beverage, wine, or beer.
9. In the case of a retail beer or wine permittee, knowingly allow the mixing or adding of alcohol or any alcoholic beverage to beer, wine, or any other
beverage in or about the permittee's place of business.
10. Knowingly permit or engage in any criminal activity on the premises covered by the license or permit.
11. Sell or dispense any wine on the premises covered by the permit or permit the consumption on the premises between the hours of two o'clock
(2:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. on a weekday, and between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. on Sunday and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. on the
following Monday, however, a holder of a wine permit authorized to sell wine on Sunday may sell or dispense wine between the hours of eight o'clock
(8:00) A.M. on Sunday and two o'clock (2:00) A.M. on the following Monday.
C. A person under legal age shall not misrepresent the person's age for the purpose of purchasing or attempting to purchase any alcoholic beverage,
wine, or beer from any licensee or permittee. If any person under legal age misrepresents the person's age, and the licensee or permittee establishes
that the licensee or permittee made reasonable inquiry to determine whether the prospective purchaser was over legal age, the licensee or permittee is
not guilty of selling alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer to a person under legal age.
D. No privilege of selling alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer on Sunday as provided in Iowa Code sections 123.36, subsection 6, and 123.134, subsection 5,
shall be granted to a club or other organization which places restrictions on admission or membership in the club or organization on the basis of sex,
race, religion, or national origin. However, the privilege may be granted to a club or organization which places restrictions on membership on the basis
of sex, if the club or organization has an auxiliary organization open to persons of the other sex. (Ord. 1726, 1-29-2007)
3-2-14: UNLIMITED SERVINGS:
A person or club holding a liquor control license or beer or wine permit, and the person's or club's agents or employees shall not sell, offer to sell, dispense
or serve for on premises consumption an unlimited number of servings of alcoholic liquor, wine or beer for a fixed price.
Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit a holder of a liquor control license or wine or beer permit, or its employees or agents, from: a)
including servings or drinks of alcoholic liquor, wine or beer as part of a hotel or motel package which includes overnight accommodations; b) providing a
fixed price for an unlimited or indefinite amount of drinks for a "private event", which is defined as an event restricted to a particular group or persons,
provided that the licensee or permittee shall provide means or method by which to identify persons participating in the private event, such as the use of a
separate room or a means to identify such participants; or c) as otherwise permitted for a special event by the city council (provided, however, that no
permit holder shall be allowed to hold such a special event under this provision c more than twice per year). (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-15: ADVERTISEMENTS FOR ALCOHOLIC LIQUOR, WINE OR BEER:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.51 is adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-16: CRIMINAL AND CIVIL PENALTIES:
A. Any person who violates any of the provisions of section 3-2-13 of this chapter, or Iowa Code section 123.49, except subsection 3-2-13B8 of this
chapter, shall be guilty of a simple misdemeanor. A person who violates subsection 3-2-13B8 of this chapter, or Iowa Code section 123.49, commits a
simple misdemeanor punishable as a scheduled violation under Iowa Code section 805.8C, subsection 2.
B. The conviction of any liquor control licensee, wine permittee, or beer permittee for a violation of any of the provisions of section 3-2-13 of this chapter, or
Iowa Code section 123.49, subject to subsection C of this section, is grounds for the suspension or revocation of the license or permit by the Iowa
alcohol beverages division or the local authority. However, if any liquor control licensee is convicted of any violation of subsection 3-2-13B1, B4 or B5 of
this chapter, or any wine or beer permittee is convicted of a violation of subsection 3-2-13B1 or B5 of this chapter, the liquor control license, wine
permit, or beer permit shall be revoked and shall immediately be surrendered by the holder, and the bond, if any, of the license or permit holder shall be
forfeited to the Iowa alcohol beverages division.
C. If any licensee, wine permittee, beer permittee, or employee of a licensee or permittee is convicted or found in violation of subsection 3-2-13B8 of this
chapter, or Iowa Code section 123.49, the administrator or local authority shall, in addition to criminal penalties fixed for violations by this section,
assess a civil penalty as follows:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 175/687
1. A first violation shall subject the licensee or permittee to a civil penalty in the amount of five hundred dollars ($500.00). Failure to pay the civil penalty
as ordered under Iowa Code section 123.39 shall result in automatic suspension of the license or permit for a period of fourteen (14) days.
2. A second violation within two (2) years shall subject the licensee or permittee to a thirty (30) day suspension and a civil penalty in the amount of one
thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500.00).
3. A third violation within three (3) years shall subject the licensee or permittee to a sixty (60) day suspension and a civil penalty in the amount of one
thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500.00).
4. A fourth violation within three (3) years shall result in revocation of the license or permit.
5. For purposes of this subsection:
a. The date of any violation shall be used in determining the period between violations.
b. Suspension shall be limited to the specific license or permit for the premises found in violation.
c. Notwithstanding Iowa Code section 123.40, revocation shall be limited to the specific license or permit found in violation and shall not disqualify a
licensee or permittee from holding a license or permit at a separate location.
D. In addition to any other penalties imposed under this section or chapter, the Iowa alcohol beverages division shall assess a civil penalty up to the
amount of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) upon a class E liquor control licensee when the class E liquor license is revoked for a violation of Iowa
Code section 123.59. Failure to pay the civil penalty as required under this subsection shall result in forfeiture of the bond to the Iowa alcohol
beverages division. (Ord. 1725, 1-29-2007)
3-2-17: SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE OR PERMIT; CIVIL PENALTY:
Iowa Code (2005) section 123.39 is adopted herein by reference. (Ord. 1648, 9-26-2005)
3-2-18: HEARING ON SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION:
The city council shall conduct a hearing on each suspension or revocation in the following manner:
A. Notice: The permit holder, and the surety on his bond, shall be served with written notice containing a copy of the complaint against him, the ordinance
provisions or state statutes allegedly violated and the date, time and place for hearing on the matter.
B. Hearing: The council shall conduct a hearing, at which both the permit holder and complainants shall be present, the purpose of which is to determine
the truth of the facts alleged in the complaint. Should the permit holder or his authorized representative fail to appear without good cause, the council
may proceed to a determination of the complaint.
C. Rights Of Permit Holder: The permit holder shall have the right to be represented by counsel, to testify and present witnesses in his own behalf and to
cross examine adverse witnesses.
D. Evidence: The council shall admit only reliable and substantial evidence into the revocation or suspension proceeding and shall give all admitted
evidence its natural probative value.
E. Criminal Charges: In the event that criminal charges have been brought against the permit holder on the same facts and circumstances as are the basis
for the revocation or suspension complaint, the council shall await a judgment in the criminal action before conducting the revocation or temporary
suspension hearing required by this section.
F. Record And Determination: The council shall make and record findings of fact and conclusions of law, and shall revoke or suspend a permit under this
section only when, upon review of the entire record, it finds clear and convincing evidence of a substantial violation of this chapter or state law. (Ord.
1648, 9-26-2005)
Chapter 3
HOTEL AND MOTEL TAX
3-3-1: IMPOSITION; RATE:
A tax is hereby imposed upon the gross receipts from the renting of any and all rooms, apartments or sleeping quarters in any hotel or motel as defined
herein, at the rate of seven percent (7%) of such gross receipts derived from the renting of a room, apartment or sleeping quarter while rented by the same
person for a period of not more than thirty one (31) consecutive days. (1985 Code §1-5.01; amd. 1993 Code)
3-3-2: DEFINITIONS:
Unless otherwise expressly stated or the context clearly indicates a different intention, the following terms shall, for the purpose of this chapter, have the
meanings in this section:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 176/687
HOTEL AND MOTEL: Any hotel, motel, inn, or any place where sleeping accommodations are furnished to transient guests for rent, whether with or
without meals, except the gross receipts from the renting of sleeping rooms in dormitories and in memorial unions of all state of Iowa universities and
colleges.
LONG TERM RENTAL: Lodging within a dwelling unit available for use or is used to accommodate guests paying a fee or other compensation for a period
of more than thirty one (31) consecutive days.
RENTING AND RENT: Any kind of direct or indirect charge for any room, apartment or sleeping quarters in a hotel, motel or short term or "long term
rental" as defined herein.
SHORT TERM RENTAL: Lodging within a dwelling unit available for use or is used to accommodate guests paying a fee or other compensation for a
period of less than thirty one (31) consecutive days. (Ord. 2136, 1-26-2016)
3-3-3: PAYMENT OF TAX:
Such tax shall be paid as is provided in senate file 336, acts of the 67th general assembly, second session1, and the proceeds of such tax shall be used
for the purposes stated in section 2, subsection 4 of said act:
1.The revenue derived from any hotel and motel tax authorized by this Act shall be used as follows:
A. Each county or city which levies the tax shall spend at least fifty percent of the revenues derived therefrom for the acquisition of sites for, or
constructing, improving, enlarging, equipping, repairing, operating, or maintaining of recreation, convention, cultural, or entertainment facilities including
but not limited to memorial buildings, halls and monuments, civic center convention buildings, auditoriums, coliseums, and parking areas or facilities
located at those recreation, convention, cultural, or entertainment facilities or the payment of principal and interest, when due, on bonds or other
evidence of indebtedness issued by the county or city for those recreation, convention, cultural, or entertainment facilities; or for the promotion and
encouragement of tourist and convention business in the city or county and surrounding areas.
The remaining revenues may be spent by the city or county which levies the tax for any city or county operations authorized by law as a proper
purpose for the expenditure within statutory limitations of city or county revenues derived from ad valorem taxes.
Any city or county which levies and collects the hotel and motel tax authorized by this Act may pledge an amount not to exceed thirty percent of the
revenues derived therefrom to the payment of bonds which the city or county may issue for one or more of the purposes set forth in paragraph (A) of
this subsection. Any revenue pledged to the payment of such bonds may be credited to the spending requirement of paragraph (A) of this subsection.
(1985 Code §1-5.04)
3-3-4: EFFECTIVE DATE:
The tax herein established shall be imposed after voter approved, and such tax shall then be imposed upon the first day of the calendar quarter following
such election; i.e., January 1, April 1, July 1 or September 1, as to which effective notice of such imposition can be given. (1985 Code §1-5.03; amd. 1993
Code)
Chapter 4
ALARM SYSTEMS
3-4-1: PURPOSE:
It is the purpose of this chapter to protect the general public traveling the streets and the West Des Moines police, fire and emergency medical services
departments and their personnel from dangers created in response to erroneous, false and mistaken response calls from security, fire or other specialized
electronic or mechanical alarms or alarm systems.
It is the further purpose of this chapter to provide penalties for the operation of faulty alarm systems and penalties for the unnecessary expenditure of
resources due to erroneous, false and mistaken response calls. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-2: DEFINITIONS:
The following words and terms as used in this chapter shall be deemed to mean and be construed as follows, unless the context specifically indicates
otherwise:
ALARM COMPANY: Any person, firm, partnership, corporation or association who owns, manages, conducts or carries on the business of installing,
servicing, maintaining, repairing, monitoring, replacing, moving or removing, or leasing in any building or other property within the jurisdiction of the city
any known alarm system as defined herein.
BUILDING: Includes any house, dwelling, apartment, business, structure or place within the city.
BURGLAR ALARM SYSTEM: Any assembly of equipment, mechanical or electrical and including all forms of audible exterior and interior alarms arranged
to signal the occurrence of an illegal entry, holdup, and/or medical or other activity, requiring urgent attention, and to which police officers or emergency
medical technicians are expected to respond.
CHIEF: Refers to the police, EMS and/or fire chief (or their designee) of the city.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 177/687
CITY: Refers to the West Des Moines police, fire and emergency medical service departments and their authorized personnel and may be one or more of
such departments where appropriate.
FALSE ALARM: Any alarm that is activated on purpose or by accident or by system malfunction when there is no intrusion, fire, smoke or medical
emergency. The city shall have full authority and discretion to determine those situations and/or circumstances that may constitute a false alarm but which
are not defined below. However, such determinations shall be subject to the appeal process set forth in section 4-4-9 of this code.
A. Error Or Mistake: Any action by any person, firm, corporation or other entity owning or operating any dwelling, building, or place, or any action by an
agent or employee of said person, firm, corporation, or any other entity which results in the activation of an alarm system when no emergency exists.
B. Malfunction: Any unintentional activation of any alarm system caused by a mechanical malfunction, flaw in the design, installation, or maintenance of
the system. This shall not include any activation caused by extraordinary violent conditions of nature such as tornadoes, floods and earthquakes.
C. Intentional Misuse: Any intentional activation of an alarm system when no burglary, holdup, fire or other emergency exists or is in progress.
D. Canceled Alarms: Alarms that are canceled by the alarm companies before the responding police officer arrives at the scene will not be classified as
a false alarm. However, with the exception of fire alarms, if an alarm has been canceled three (3) times during the same thirty (30) day period
(month), the fourth alarm will constitute a false alarm.
FIRE ALARM SYSTEM: Any assembly of equipment, mechanical or electrical and including all forms of audible exterior and interior alarms arranged to
signal the occurrence of a fire emergency requiring urgent attention, and to which firefighters and emergency medical technicians are expected to respond.
OWNER: Includes any person, firm, corporation, entity or leaseholder causing any alarm system to be installed in any "building" as defined herein. The
owner, or designee on behalf of the owner, shall make application for a permit as required by this chapter.
PERMIT (OR REGISTRATION): Authorization granted by the chief to an owner to operate an alarm system.
RECURRING ALARM: Three (3) or more alarms in a twenty four (24) hour period.
TAGGED OR TAGGING: The method by which the fire department identifies the condition of the alarm system and/or the system's compliance with all
relevant city codes.
VERIFY: An attempt to avoid an unnecessary burglar alarm dispatch request by the monitoring company, or its representative, by attempting to contact the
burglar alarm site and/or burglar alarm user by telephone or other electronic means to determine whether an alarm signal is valid before requesting law
enforcement dispatch. As a minimum, a second call shall be made to a different number if the first verification call attempt fails to reach a burglar alarm
user who can properly identify themselves to determine whether an alarm signal is valid before requesting law enforcement dispatch. Audio verification,
video verification, or cross zoning shall be permitted in addition to the first and second verification call.
WESTCOM: A joint emergency dispatch center providing services for the cities of Clive, Urbandale and West Des Moines. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-3: LICENSING, INSTALLATION AND PENALTIES:
A. Alarm Company Licensing: Any alarm company operating within the jurisdiction of the city shall be licensed with the city clerk or the clerk's designee
prior to conducting business within the jurisdiction of the city.
1. Alarm installation licenses shall be issued annually on a calendar year basis. All applications for licenses shall be filed with the city clerk on forms
provided for that purpose. The annual license fee shall be one hundred dollars ($100.00), except, however, if an application is filed on or after July 1
of a calendar year the license fee shall be fifty dollars ($50.00). A license shall thereafter be renewed annually on January 1. Combined license fees
for companies installing both security and fire alarms will be assessed an additional twenty five dollars ($25.00). License fees shall be payable to the
city clerk prior to the issuance of the annual license.
2. An alarm company also providing monitoring of alarms shall have a separate monitoring license. Additional annual license fees are twenty five
dollars ($25.00).
3. The completed alarm company license application, license fee and if applicable, the names and copies of the certifications of those individuals that
will be stamping plans as required by subsection B2 of this section shall be included with the license application.
B. Installation Of Fire Alarm Systems:
1. Commercial Buildings: Installations, servicing, maintaining, repairing, replacing, moving or removing, or causing to be sold, or leasing of fire alarm
systems in any commercial building within the city shall be installed in accordance with the most recently adopted edition of NFPA 72 and the most
recently adopted West Des Moines fire code.
2. Commercial Fire Alarm Plans: All commercial fire alarm plans submitted for review shall be designed and stamped by an individual holding at a
minimum one or more certifications or designations as required and adopted in the most recent addition to the West Des Moines fire code.
3. Testing Commercial Systems: All new commercial fire alarm systems shall be tested according to the most recently adopted edition of NFPA 72 prior
to the final inspection by the fire department. The fire department will observe a cursory test during the final inspection. Copies of inspections
regarding maintenance, revision and repair of commercial fire alarm systems that have been tagged "RED", indicating noncompliance with this code,
shall be provided to the fire department within five (5) working days after completion of such maintenance, revision or repair.
4. Monitoring Systems: Fire alarm systems shall be monitored by an Underwriters Laboratory (UL) or Factory Mutual (FM) listed monitoring company.
Documents associated with such listings or certifications shall be submitted for approval by the fire department. Tagging of fire alarm systems shall
be by tags approved by the fire department.
5. Licensing Conditions: No system shall be designed to signal an alarm directly to the Westcom dispatch center. No system shall be placed in service
until the owner has applied for or obtained a permit from the city clerk's office. As a condition of licensing all alarm companies are required to use a
UL or FM listed or an approved listed system for monitoring all fire alarm systems. The fire chief shall have the right to review the type of installation
of any fire alarm system being installed. Such review shall not constitute an approval of the type, installation or method of signalization being utilized
or employed.
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 178/687
6. Initiating Device Installed: Beginning March 1, 2002, all new fire alarm systems shall be installed with each initiating device on a separate point or
zone.
7. Control Panel: Only one fire alarm control panel is allowed per building.
8. Registration Form And Fee: Alarm companies are responsible for providing the owner with an alarm permit registration form provided by the city
clerk's office. They are also responsible for collecting the ten dollar ($10.00) registration fee and submitting the fee and fully completed registration
form to the city clerk's office within three (3) working days of receipt. Licensed alarm companies/installers shall provide a quarterly list of actively
monitored customers and addresses indicating where service is provided in the city of West Des Moines.
9. Notification Of Changes: All alarm companies shall, upon notice from a customer of cessation of existing service, notify the city clerk's office in the
next required quarterly list. The quarterly cessation of existing service list must be clearly differentiated from the quarterly actively monitored
customers lists.
C. Installation Of Burglar Alarm Systems:
1. Beginning March 1, 2002, only security control panels that comply with the ANSI/SIA CP-01 standard and dual technology or PIR-01 compliant
motion sensors shall be installed.
2. Multiple tenants of a building should each have their own separate security system. A separate permit must be obtained for each alarm system
within a multiple tenant building indicating the alarm holder's unique address, including suite or unit number. Businesses, condominium owners,
apartment leasers and other occupied spaces which are located inside of a building such as a mall, strip mall or business suite which may be
secured at a centralized entrance will be responsible for their own burglar alarm and for making arrangements on how public safety personnel will
gain access to their respective property when responding to the alarm. A property manager will not be held liable for tenant/occupant's false alarms.
Monitoring devices active at shared entrances to, or shared areas within, a multiple tenant building must be registered to a single responsible party
or the property manager/owner.
3. Alarm companies are responsible for providing the owner with an alarm permit registration form provided by the city clerk's office. They are also
responsible for collecting the ten dollar ($10.00) registration fee and submitting the fee and fully completed registration form to the city clerk's office
within three (3) working days of receipt. Licensed alarm companies/installers shall provide a quarterly list of actively monitored customers and
addresses indicating where service is provided in the city of West Des Moines.
4. All alarm companies shall, upon notice from a customer of cessation of existing service, notify the city clerk's office in the next required quarterly list.
The quarterly cessation of existing service list must be clearly differentiated from the quarterly actively monitored customers lists.
5. All new multizone burglar alarms activated after July 1, 2003, shall have a "swinger suppression" function. "Swinger suppression" is a feature that is
activated at the panel which can deactivate a bad sensor or zone alarm.
D. Penalties:
1. Penalties For Violation Of Licenses: Unless otherwise provided by section 1-4-1 of this code and/or Iowa Code section 364.22, violation of any rule
or regulation as provided in this chapter shall result in a fine of up to two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) for the first violation. A second violation within
one year of license issuance shall result in a fine of up to five hundred dollars ($500.00). A third violation within one year of license issuance shall
result in a fine of up to seven hundred fifty dollars ($750.00) and revocation of the license for the remainder of the license period. An alarm company
operating without a license shall be subject to the penalty of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00). Any outstanding fines shall be paid by the license
applicant before a new license is issued. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-4: INITIAL REGISTRATION FEE, MONTHLY MONITORING FEE:
A. All residential or business property locations in which an alarm system has been or will be installed shall be registered with the city. The registration fee
shall be ten dollars ($10.00). The owner or occupant of the residential or business property shall complete the alarm permit registration, using the form
provided by the city clerk for that purpose, and pay the registration fee to the alarm company representative, who shall be responsible for the collection
of the alarm permit registration and registration fee for alarms the company sells and/or services. The alarm company representative shall forward the
alarm permit registration and registration fee within three (3) working days of receipt to the city clerk's office.
B. Any owner causing any alarm system to be installed in any building shall, prior to allowing such alarm system to be placed in service, provide to the
alarm company, on the form provided by the city clerk's office, a completed alarm permit registration form that lists the name, address and telephone
number of one person responsible for the alarm system. This person shall be designated as the primary responsible person, and another person, if
available shall be designated as having secondary responsibility. Each responsible person shall have access to the building and the alarm system and
shall have the knowledge and ability to make the system secure in the case of activation. The owner shall also provide on the alarm permit registration
form, the name, address and telephone number of any person, firm, or corporation responsible for servicing and monitoring (where applicable) the
alarm system. It shall remain the responsibility of the owner of any alarm system to ensure that the names and telephone numbers of the responsible
persons maintained by the city clerk are current.
C. Each newly installed burglar alarm system shall be placed in a test mode for seven (7) days prior to the monitoring and reporting of alarms to the city.
This test period provides an opportunity for the new users to become thoroughly familiar with the operation of the system without risking a response to
a false alarm. Deviations from this requirement shall require the approval of the chief.
D. Alarm companies will be required to collect a monthly monitoring fee from customers whose alarms they monitor. Monitoring fees will be one dollar
($1.00) per month for residential dwellings and two dollars ($2.00) per month for commercial establishments. The monitoring fees shall be remitted by
the alarm company to the city clerk's office on a quarterly basis with a listing of the names and addresses of all actively monitored customers as well as
the locations and owner information of any newly installed, unmonitored alarms.
E. Alarm companies shall submit to the city clerk's office, on a quarterly basis, a listing of the names and addresses of all actively monitored customers as
well as the locations and owners of any newly installed, unmonitored alarms. This quarterly list must clearly differentiate between alarm companies'
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 179/687
actively monitored customers and newly installed unmonitored alarms. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-5: ISSUANCE OF PERMIT:
A. The city clerk, upon receipt of the required alarm permit registration and registration fee for all security or residential fire alarms, shall issue or renew a
permit.
B. The city clerk, upon receipt of the required alarm permit registration and registration fee for all commercial fire alarms, and upon written approval of the
chief, shall issue or renew a permit. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-6: SERVICE AVAILABLE:
Every alarm company or agent doing business within the city shall have an alarm agent, supplies and equipment so located as to be able to respond within
twenty four (24) hours to a request for repair, service, or adjustment on any alarm system that such business or agent sold, maintains, or inspects. (Ord.
1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-7: RESPONSE:
A. Prior to notification to the city that a burglar alarm has occurred, the monitoring company shall attempt to "verify" (as defined under section 3-4-2,
"Definitions", of this chapter) every such alarm. When the city is aware that any alarm system is activated, the police, EMS or fire department shall
notify the person or persons listed pursuant to subsection 3-4-4B of this chapter. Said person(s) shall immediately go to the location of the alarm to
meet the police, EMS and/or fire personnel at a safe distance from the facility. The person(s) shall, under the direction of the applicable department,
secure the building and reset the alarm. In the case of a fire alarm, the alarm shall not be reset until the fire department has had the opportunity to fully
investigate the location within any building and determine the reason for the alarm signal. The owner in control of the premises may enter into an
agreement with an alarm company to make the responses required herein. In the event of a recurring burglar alarm, the decision to respond will be
within the discretion of the police supervisor.
B. Any person responsible for any alarm system who refuses or fails to respond when notified of the alarm's activation shall be subject to the penalties
provided in subsection 3-4-11A5 of this chapter. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-8: FALSE ALARMS:
A. No alarm system shall be activated by error, mistake, intentional misuse, or malfunction in any dwelling, building or place when no emergency exists.
B. No person shall knowingly or intentionally activate any alarm system when no emergency situation exists. Any person who knowingly or intentionally
activates any false alarm shall be guilty of a municipal infraction pursuant to sections 1-4-1 and 1-4-2 of this code.
C. No person shall knowingly or intentionally test any actively monitored alarm system without first notifying and receiving approval from the Westcom
dispatch center. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-9: LIABILITY OF CITY LIMITED:
A. Upon receipt of an alarm signal by Westcom or the city, the city shall act upon the signal with reasonable dispatch. The city shall not be liable for:
1. Any defects in the operation of any alarm devices or signal lines system;
2. Any failure or neglect to respond upon receipt of notification from an alarm system;
3. The failure or neglect of any person or entity regarding the installation and/or operation of the alarm system; and
4. The transmission of alarm signals or the delaying of such signals. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-10: AUDIBLE ALARMS; TIME OUT:
Any exterior audible burglar alarm system installed on or within any building, structure, residence or place of business shall be designed and installed to
"time out" or cease omitting its signaling activities within fifteen (15) minutes of activation. However, commercial or residential fire alarm systems shall not
be designed or installed to "time out" or cease emitting annunciation. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-11: SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION AND FALSE ALARM FEES:
A. Grounds For Suspension Or Revocation And Applicable Service Charges And Penalties:
1. Grounds For Suspension Or Revocation: The following shall constitute grounds for suspension and/or revocation of a license or permit:
a. The violation of any of the provisions of this chapter; or
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 180/687
b. When an alarm system is knowingly activated by a licensee, permit holder, owner or an employee or agent of said parties, in a situation where no
burglary, fire, intrusion, robbery, medical emergency or other emergency is actually in progress; or
c. When the licensee, permit holder, owner or an employee or agent of said parties has knowingly made any false, misleading or fraudulent
statement of material fact in the application for a license, permit, or in any report or record required to be filed with the city; or
d. When an alarm system actuates excessive false alarms and thereby constitutes a public nuisance. Three (3) false alarms, as defined herein, in
the period of one calendar year shall be deemed excessive. New alarm installations shall be granted a thirty (30) day break-in and adjustment
period before being subject to the provisions of this subsection; or
e. When the person or persons listed pursuant to subsection 3-4-4B of this chapter refuse or fail to respond promptly, or are frequently unavailable
for notification of alarm activation pursuant to section 3-4-7 of this chapter; or
f. Failure to pay applicable fees.
2. Service Charge: A service charge shall be made for each false alarm beyond the number permitted in this section. The service charge for each false
alarm shall be:

3. Revocation Or No Permit Service Charge: If a permit is under revocation or if no permit has been issued, the service charge shall be twice the
service charge established above.
4. Nonregistered Alarms: If an alarm has not been registered pursuant to the requirements of this code, the owner or responsible party will have thirty
(30) days following notification by the city to register the alarm. Failure of the owner or responsible party to register within thirty (30) days of
notification will subject the owner or responsible party to a two hundred fifty dollar ($250.00) penalty.
5. Failure To Respond Penalty: After being personally notified, failure of an alarm owner or responsible party to respond to the location of an activated
alarm following a request from the police, fire or EMS department to do so will subject the owner or responsible party to a two hundred fifty dollar
($250.00) penalty.
B. Procedure: The city clerk, in the case of suspension, shall serve the permit holder with a written order of suspension stating the reasons for the
suspension. The order shall be effective immediately if personally served or five (5) working days after the order of suspension has been deposited by
ordinary mail postage prepaid in the U.S. mail to the address provided on the permit. When an order becomes effective, the permit holder shall
immediately discontinue the use of any alarm system requiring a permit under this chapter and cease all operations conducted under the authority of
any permit, unless such alarm is mandated or required as a matter of federal, state, or local law and cannot be disconnected. If the owner or operator
of such alarm system continues to maintain the use of the alarm, for each "false alarm" as defined in section 3-4-2 of this chapter, the owner or
operator of the alarm shall be charged a fee per response according to the provisions contained in subsections A2 and A3 of this section.
C. Revocation: A suspension shall become a revocation fifteen (15) days after the order of suspension becomes effective unless the permit holder files an
appeal of the order of suspension in the manner as set forth in section 4-4-9 of this code. When an appeal is filed, the order of suspension shall be
stayed pending final determination of the appeal. The suspension shall become a revocation if the decision of the hearing officer upholds the
suspension unless the decision is ultimately overruled by an appellate body pursuant to section 4-4-9 of this code. The suspension shall be dissolved
immediately if the decision of the hearing officer reverses the suspension. If the hearing officer and/or the appellate body concur in the suspension and
at least fifteen (15) days have elapsed since notification to the permit holder of the suspension, the suspension shall be deemed a revocation of the
permit.
D. Surrender Of Permit: If any permit is revoked pursuant to this chapter, the permit holder shall immediately surrender the permit to the city clerk.
E. Reinstatement Of Alarm Privilege: Whenever an alarm system which is under suspension, revocation or renewal has been repaired or modified so as to
be capable of functioning properly, or as appropriate, additional user training has been provided and the chief has received from a properly licensed
alarm company written certification to such effect, the chief may recommend to the city clerk reinstatement of the alarm permit, and the permit shall
then be issued or reinstated. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-2004)
3-4-12: APPEAL PROCEDURE:
Any permit holder aggrieved by the decision of the city shall have the right of appeal regarding a denial of an application for a permit or renewal thereof, or
for any penalty assessed or any order of suspension issued. The appeal will follow the process set forth in section 4-4-9 of this code. (Ord. 1569, 2-2-
2004)
3-4-13: ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURES:

Chapter 5
BANKRUPT, GOING OUT OF BUSINESS, FIRE SALES
(Rep. by Ord. 2009, 10-14-2013)
Chapter 6
MASSAGE ESTABLISHMENTS AND TECHNICIANS
3-6-1: PURPOSE:
State of Iowa licensed massage therapists and businesses offering massage therapy services perform an important service in addressing the health and
well-being of West Des Moines residents. Unfortunately, there are businesses that advertise they provide massage therapy and/or other therapeutic
services, but they engage in various illegal activities, which may include prostitution and/or human trafficking. It is not the intention of this chapter to
discourage legitimate, licensed massage therapists or massage therapy businesses from providing their services within West Des Moines. The purpose of
this chapter is to identify and address businesses that engage in the practice of massage therapy without valid licenses and/or are involved in illegal
activities, which may include prostitution and/or human trafficking. Businesses providing massage therapy, but also conducting various types of illegal
activity, are harmful to the health, safety, and welfare of the City and negatively impact the massage therapy profession. The implementation of this
chapter will better enable the City to proactively screen, monitor, and remove businesses that engage in illegal activity. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-2: DEFINITIONS:
For the purposes of this chapter, the following words and phrases have the meanings herein set forth, unless it is apparent from the context that a different
meaning is intended.
APPLICANT: Means any person, firm, corporation, or other legal entity applying for a license to operate a massage therapy business.
EMPLOYEE: Means any person who performs any service on the premises of a massage therapy business on a full time, part time, or contract basis,
regardless of whether the person is considered an employee, independent contractor, agent, apprentice, trainee, or otherwise.
LICENSE: Means permission granted by competent authority to exercise a certain privilege that, without such authorization, would constitute an illegal act.
The document that confers permission to a person engaged in massage therapy shall be issued by the State of Iowa Board of Massage Therapy. Massage
therapy business licenses shall be issued by the City of West Des Moines.
MASSAGE PATRON: Means any person who receives, or pays to receive, a massage or massage services from a massage therapist for value.
MASSAGE THERAPIST: Means a person licensed to practice the health care service of the healing art of massage therapy under Iowa Code chapter
152C.
MASSAGE THERAPY: Means performance for compensation of massage, myotherapy, massotherapy, bodywork, bodywork therapy, or therapeutic
massage, including hydrotherapy, superficial hot and cold applications, vibration and topical applications, or other therapy which involves manipulation of
the muscle and connective tissue of the body, excluding osseous tissue, to treat the muscle tonus system for the purpose of enhancing health, muscle
relaxation, increasing range of motion, reducing stress, relieving pain, or improving circulation.
MASSAGE THERAPY BUSINESS: Means any business or place of business, including mobile, temporary, and transient businesses, wherein, or on
whose behalf, any of the treatments, techniques, or methods of treatment referred to as "massage therapy" are administered, practiced, used, given, or
applied.
PREMISES: Means the real property, or portion thereof, upon which the massage therapy business is located, including but not limited to, the buildings,
grounds, private walkways, parking lots, and parking garages through which the business has access, control, or ownership.
REFLEXOLOGY: Means manipulation of the soft tissues of the human body which is restricted to the hands, feet, or ears, performed by persons who do
not hold themselves out to be massage therapists or to be performing massage therapy.
SPECIFIED CRIMINAL ACTIVITY: Means any of the following specified crimes:
A. Any crime identified in Iowa Code chapter 709 - Sexual Abuse (2017), Iowa Code chapter 710 - Kidnapping and Related Offenses (2017), or Iowa
Code chapter 710A - Human Trafficking (2017);
B. Prostitution, leasing premises for prostitution, pimping, or pandering, as those crimes have been identified in Iowa Code chapter 725 (2017), or any
crime identified in Iowa Code chapter 726 - Protection of the Family and Dependent Persons (2017);
C. Any crime identified in Iowa Code chapter 728 - Obscenity (2017);
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 182/687
D. Any crime that requires sex offender registration pursuant to Iowa Code chapter 692A - Sex Offender Registry (2017);
E. Any crime involving serious injury or death to another person, robbery, burglary, felony theft, fraud, forgery, identity theft, aggravated harassment, or
stalking; and
F. Any criminal offense in another jurisdiction that, had the predicate act(s) been committed in Iowa, would have constituted any of the foregoing
offenses. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-3: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person, firm, corporation, or other legal entity shall operate a massage therapy business, either exclusively or in connection with another business,
without first obtaining a license from the City as provided in this chapter. Licenses shall be subject to renewal on an annual basis. A separate license shall
be obtained for each business or place of business. The licensee shall display the license in a prominent place in the licensed business at all times. (Ord.
2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-4: LICENSE FEE:
At the time of submittal of a massage therapy business license application, the applicant shall pay to the City Clerk the applicable license fee. The City
Council shall establish the amount of the license fee for initial and renewal licenses by resolution. Any licenses surrendered, suspended, or revoked prior
to the date of expiration shall not be entitled to a refund of any portion of the license fee. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-5: LICENSE APPLICATION:
Application for a massage therapy business license shall be submitted on forms provided by the City Clerk's Office. The application shall include the
following information:
A. The address of the massage therapy business property and documentation establishing the applicant's interest in the premises on which the business
will be located, which shall be in the form of a lease, deed, or other document that establishes the applicant's interest in the property.
B. The full legal name, date of birth, and residential address of each applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person who is or will
be present on the premises to perform massage therapy, regardless of the legal relationship between the licensee and the persons performing
massage therapy services.
C. Dates and locations of other places the applicant has owned or operated as a massage therapy business.
D. Each new applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person who is or will be present on the premises to perform massage
therapy, who resides in the State of Iowa, shall provide, at the applicant's expense, an officially sealed State of Iowa Division of Criminal Investigation
(DCI) personal background check to the City, which is dated no more than thirty (30) days prior to the application. Those who do not reside in the State
of Iowa shall provide, at the applicant's expense, an equivalent personal background check from the applicant's state of residence.
E. Each new applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person who is or will be present on the premises to perform massage
therapy shall be fingerprinted and photographed by the City's Police Department at the applicant's expense.
F. A statement as to whether each applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person providing massage therapy on behalf of the
massage therapy business has ever been convicted of specified criminal activity as defined in this chapter. The statement shall include details
regarding the type of each charge and the date and location of the incident(s) in question.
G. A statement as to whether the applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person providing massage therapy on behalf of the
massage therapy business has had any license to perform massage therapy denied, revoked, or suspended in any city, county, state, or any country
and the reason for the denial, revocation, or suspension.
H. A copy of a state government issued photo identification of each new applicant, owner, manager, employee, agent, contractor, or other person present
on the premises who has or will provide massage therapy, or other proof that the person is legally authorized to work in the United States.
I. Provide proof of current State of Iowa massage therapy licenses for all persons present on the premises who have or will provide massage therapy.
J. All applicants and licensees shall be required to promptly notify the City during the application review or the term of the license if there are any new
owners, managers, employees, agents, contractors, or other persons who are or will be present on the premises to perform massage therapy and shall
immediately submit updated information to the City pursuant to this chapter, including but not limited to a personal background check, photographing,
fingerprinting, and proof of identification, as well as any amendments to the statements provided as required by this chapter. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-6: GRANTING OR DENIAL OF LICENSE:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 183/687
License applications shall be reviewed by the City and the City shall either grant or deny the license. The City shall inform the applicant regarding the
reasons for a license denial. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-7: CONDITIONS GOVERNING ISSUANCE:
A. No license shall be issued if the applicant or any of its owners, managers, employees, contractors, agents, or other persons performing massage
therapy at the massage therapy business has a criminal conviction for specified criminal activity as defined in this chapter or who is a registered sex
offender. No license shall be issued if the applicant has been denied a license by another community unless the applicant has provided the City with
sufficient proof that the basis for the license denial has been remedied.
B. Licenses shall be issued only if the applicant and all of its owners, managers, employees, contractors, agents, or other persons performing massage
therapy at the massage therapy business are free of convictions for specified criminal activity as defined in this chapter or which relate directly to such
person's ability or fitness to legally and safely perform the duties and discharge the responsibilities of the licensed activity.
C. Licenses shall only be issued to applicants who have provided all of the information requested in the application, have paid required license fees, and
have cooperated with the City during its review of the application.
D. If issued, the license shall be displayed in a conspicuous place on the business premises so that it can be readily seen by the public upon entering the
business. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-8: LICENSE PERIOD:
Licenses shall be granted by the City on an annual, calendar year basis. Each license issued shall terminate on December 31 of that year. Licensees shall
obtain a renewal license from the City prior to expiration of an existing license. Licensees shall apply to the City for a renewal license by December 1 of
that year to allow the City sufficient time to review a license renewal application. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-9: EXEMPTIONS:
This chapter shall not apply to the following businesses:
A. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons who are licensed to practice medicine or surgery, osteopathic medicine or surgery,
chiropractic, cosmetology arts and sciences, or podiatry in the State of Iowa; or athletic trainers, nurses, occupational therapists, physical therapists, or
physician assistants licensed, certified, or registered in the State of Iowa or acting under the prescription or supervision of a person licensed to practice
medicine or surgery or osteopathic medicine and surgery in the State of Iowa.
B. Massage therapists who are employed or are contracted to perform massage therapy in a business identified in subsection A of this section.
C. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons who are licensed, registered, or certified in another state, territory, the District of Columbia,
or a foreign country when incidentally and temporarily present in the State of Iowa to teach a course of instruction related to massage and bodywork
therapy.
D. Businesses which offer the services of students enrolled in a program recognized by the State of Iowa Board of Massage Therapy while completing a
clinical requirement for graduation performed under the supervision of a licensed person.
E. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons practicing reflexology.
F. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons engaged within the scope of practice of a profession with established standards and ethics
utilizing touch, words, and directed movement to deepen awareness of existing patterns of movement in the body as well as to suggest new
possibilities of movement, provided that the practices performed or services rendered are not designated or implied to be massage therapy. Such
practices include, but are not limited to, the Feldenkrais method, the Trager approach, and mind-body centering.
G. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons engaged within the scope of practice of a profession with established standards and ethics
in which touch is limited to that which is essential for palpitation and affectation of the human energy system, provided that the practices performed or
services rendered are not designated or implied to be massage therapy.
H. Businesses who employ or provide the services of persons incidentally present in the State of Iowa to provide services as part of an emergency
response team working in conjunction with disaster relief officials. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-10: GROUNDS FOR DENIAL, SUSPENSION, OR REVOCATION OF LICENSE:
In addition to any other reasons set forth in this chapter, it shall be grounds for denial, suspension, and/or revocation of a massage therapy application or
business license if one or more of the following conditions have occurred:
6/5/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=568 184/687
A. If the applicant or licensee has not complied with or has a history of violations of the laws and ordinances that might adversely impact public health or
safety.
B. If the applicant or licensee solicits or advertises to offer services that are in violation of this chapter.
C. If the applicant or licensee has been convicted of any violation, reasonably related to the activity to be or that has been licensed, or has occurred on the
licensed premises, of any City ordinance, State Statute, or Federal law.
D. If there has been any fraud or deception involved in the license application process.
E. If the licensee has been found to be in control or possession of any narcotic drugs or controlled substances on the business premises for which they are
licensed to operate, possession of which is illegal as defined by City ordinance, State Statute, or Federal law.
F. If the applicant or licensee has engaged in willful disregard of Health or Safety Codes and regulations.
G. If the applicant fails to provide all of the information required by this chapter, including any failure to promptly submit updated information.
H. If the licensee permits an unlicensed individual or unlicensed individuals to conduct massage therapy services at the licensee's premises.
I. If the licensee refuses to allow any police officers or government officials to inspect the premises or operations.
J. If the licensee has been found to be in violation of the provisions of this chapter or the Iowa Code.
K. If the business promotes its services through websites that are known to advertise services that are illegal. (Ord. 2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-11: NOTICE; APPEAL:
A. Notice: The City Clerk shall have the applicant or licensee served with notice either in person or by regular mail to the licensee's address shown on the
license application notifying the licensee of the license denial, suspension, or revocation and the specific reason(s) for such action. The applicant or
licensee shall be prohibited from any further activities covered by the license during the term of any suspension or revocation, including during any
appeal periods unless otherwise allowed by court order.
B. Appeal: The applicant or licensee shall have ten (10) calendar days from the date of the notice to appeal the City's denial, suspension, or revocation of
a massage therapy business license. The appeal must be in writing and filed with the City Clerk during normal City Hall business hours. The Municipal
Code Hearing Officer, as provided in section 4-4-9 of this Code, shall hear the appeal and may reverse, modify, or affirm the City's decision.
C. Appeal Of Adverse Appeal Decision: The applicant or licensee or the City may then appeal an adverse decision by the Municipal Code Hearing Officer
to the Polk County, Iowa, District Court within thirty (30) calendar days from the date of the Hearing Officer's decision.
D. Waiver To Contest: Failure to appeal any decision within the provided time frame shall constitute a waiver of any right to contest the decision. (Ord.
2268, 12-27-2017)
3-6-12: RESTRICTIONS AND REGULATIONS:
A. Compliance With Law: The licensee and all of its employees and contractors shall comply with all applicable regulations and laws of the City and State
